content:
That's completely understandable! 2x speed can be a bit too intense, especially if you're trying to absorb complex information or follow nuanced discussions. 1.5x is a great sweet spot, as it allows you to speed up your listening without sacrificing comprehension.

It's also worth noting that some podcasters might not be optimized for 2x speed, so you might miss out on some of the nuances of their delivery, tone, and pacing. 1.5x is a good compromise that still allows you to appreciate the podcasters' style while getting through the content more efficiently.

Now, I'm curious – what do you think about podcast discovery and recommendation algorithms? Do you find that they're helpful in finding new podcasts, or do you prefer to rely on word of mouth or online communities for recommendations?
